facts: Atoms are so small that a single grain of sand contains billions of them.
Sound is a vibration that travels through materials like air or water, which is why you cannot hear in outer space where there is almost no air.
Gravity pulls everything with mass toward everything else, and it is what keeps planets in orbit around the Sun.
Most of Earthâ€™s oxygen is made by tiny ocean plants called phytoplankton, not just by forests.
A molecule of water is made of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom, which is why its formula is H2O.
Electricity is the movement of tiny charged particles called electrons through a material.
The speed of light in space is about 300,000 kilometers per second, making it the fastest thing we know in the universe.
sources_hint: Look up these topics in kid-friendly references like NASA, National Geographic Education, Britannica School, and science textbooks covering atoms, gravity, waves, ecosystems, chemistry, electricity, and light.
